Done! I've added the --all parameter functionality to your claude-to-adium tool. Here's what I implemented:
  1. Modified the main function to handle the --all flag
  2. Created processAllConversations function that:
    • Takes a project name and theme name
    • Finds all .jsonl conversation files in the project folder
    • Creates a claude-conversations subfolder for output
    • Processes each conversation individually
  3. Updated generateHTML to accept an optional custom output directory parameter

Now you can use it like this: 

claude-to-adium "project-name" "theme-name" --all

This will process all conversations in the specified project folder and save them in a claude-conversations subfolder with organized output directories for each conversation.

Perfect! I've updated the --all functionality to show the interactive choosers when parameters are not provided. Now you can use it in three ways:
  1. With all parameters: claude-to-adium "project-name" "theme-name" --all
  2. Interactive mode: claude-to-adium --all (shows choosers for project and theme)
  3. Regular single conversation mode: claude-to-adium (original behavior)

The interactive mode for --all:

  • Shows the same project and theme choosers as the regular mode
  • Clearly indicates that ALL conversations will be processed
  • Provides the command for future use
  • Processes all conversations into a claude-conversations subfolder
